channel.title: Burn Wise
channel.description: Updated Burn Wise content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Burn Wise Awareness Kit
item.description:
The Burn Wise health and safety awareness kit was developed for state, local, and tribal air agencies and other groups working to reduce wood smoke pollution. The kit includes best burn tips, social media messages, fast facts, an article template and other tools.  Use or share this material through local media, websites, and social media sites during the burn season. 

  • Introduction (PDF)(3 pp, 132 K)
  • Fast Facts (PDF)(2 pp, 153 K)
  • Health and Safety Tips (PDF)(2 pp, 153 K)
  • Social Media Messages (PDF)(4 pp, 149 K)
item.dc:creator: mpayne02

item.title: Burn Wise Outreach Materials for Retailers
item.description:
Retailers play an important role in educating the public, and providing them with tools to make the right decisions about what and how they burn.  Working with the hearth industry, EPA has developed Burn Wise outreach tools specifically for retailers.  These materials are designed to: 

  • educate users on how to properly use wood burning appliances, and burn dry wood
  • encourage upgrades to cleaner burning technologies, like gas or EPA-certified stoves

In addition, the materials are meant to ensure the home owner understands the benefits- improved efficiency, a safer home and a healthier family- of taking action to burn cleaner and more efficiently.

Get more details on Burn Wise outreach, the many tools available, how to use them, and the benefits to retailers.

Ordering Information

TO ORDER Burn Wise MATERIALS: contact Larry Brockman, at brockman.larry@epa.gov or 919-541-5398 or send in a materials request form to Larry Brockman; T.W. Alexander Drive; M/S C304-05; Durham, NC 27711-0001.

Outreach Materials

The following outreach materials are free, and most are available for bulk shipping.

  • Tip Sheets available in English and Spanish
  • Brochures available in English and Spanish
  • Posters
  • Other Materials

Burn Wise Widget: This application displays wood-burning tips directly on your web page and provides a link to the Burn Wise website. Once you add the widget to your page, Burn Wise will update the content automatically.
item.dc:creator: mpayne02

item.dc:creator: gblais

item.title: Process for Developing Improved Cordwood Test Methods for Wood Heaters
item.description:
This Discussion Paper suggests a process for transitioning to test methods for residential wood heaters that are more representative of how cordwood fueled heaters are used in people’s homes. EPA seeks input from any interested party on how to improve current cordwood test methods and balance representation of in-home use with precision and variability concerns as the Agency considers the development of a reference method. EPA has established a non-rulemaking docket for any input, questions or suggestions relevant to this Discussion Paper under Docket ID No. EPA-HQ-OAR-2016-0130.

  • Process for Developing Improved Cordwood Test Methods for Wood Heaters (PDF)(80 pp, 778 K)
item.dc:creator: mpayne02
